verses.verse: (A Maskil of Asaph.) O God, <WH430> why <WH4100> hast Thou rejected <WH2186> [us] forever <WH5331>? Why does Thine anger <WH639> smoke <WH6225> against the sheep <WH6629> of Thy pasture <WH4830>?

Remember <WH2142> Thy congregation, <WH5712> which Thou hast purchased <WH7069> of old, <WH6924> Which Thou hast redeemed <WH1350> to be the tribe <WH7626> of Thine inheritance; <WH5159> [And] this <WH2088> Mount <WH2022> Zion, <WH6726> where <WH2088> Thou hast dwelt. <WH7931>
Turn <WH7311> Thy footsteps <WH6471> toward the perpetual <WH5331> ruins; <WH4876> The enemy <WH340> has damaged <WH7489> everything <WH3605> within the sanctuary. <WH6944>
Thine adversaries <WH6887> have roared <WH7580> in the midst <WH7130> of Thy meeting <WH4150> place; <WH4150> They have set <WH7760> up their own standards <WH226> for signs. <WH226>
It seems <WH3045> as if one had lifted <WH935> up [His] axe <WH7134> in a forest <WH5441> of trees. <WH6086>
And now <WH6258> all <WH3162> its carved <WH6603> work <WH6603> They smash <WH1986> with hatchet <WH3781> and hammers. <WH3597>
They have burned <WH7971> <WH784> Thy sanctuary <WH4720> to the ground; <WH776> They have defiled <WH2490> the dwelling <WH4908> place <WH4908> of Thy name. <WH8034>

They said <WH559> in their heart, <WH3820> "Let us completely <WH3162> subdue <WH3238> them." They have burned <WH8313> all <WH3605> the meeting <WH4150> places <WH4150> of God <WH410> in the land. <WH776>
We do not see <WH7200> our signs; <WH226> There <WH369> is no <WH369> longer <WH5750> any prophet, <WH5030> Nor <WH3808> is there any among <WH854> us who knows <WH3045> how <WH4100> long. <WH5704>
How <WH4970> long, <WH5704> <WH4970> O God, <WH430> will the adversary <WH6862> revile, <WH2778> [And] the enemy <WH340> spurn <WH5006> Thy name <WH8034> forever <WH5331>?
Why <WH4100> dost Thou withdraw <WH7725> Thy hand, <WH3027> even Thy right <WH3225> hand <WH3225>? From within <WH7130> Thy bosom, <WH2436> destroy <WH3615> [them]!
Yet God <WH430> is my king <WH4428> from of old, <WH6924> Who works <WH6466> deeds <WH3444> of deliverance <WH3444> in the midst <WH7130> of the earth. <WH776>
Thou didst divide <WH9461> the sea <WH3220> by Thy strength; <WH5797> Thou didst break <WH7665> the heads <WH7218> of the sea <WH8577> monsters <WH8577> in the waters. <WH4325>
Thou didst crush <WH7533> the heads <WH7218> of Leviathan; <WH3882> Thou didst give <WH5414> him as food <WH3978> for the creatures <WH5971> of the wilderness. <WH9478>
Thou didst break <WH1234> open <WH1234> springs <WH4599> and torrents; <WH5158> Thou didst dry <WH3001> up ever-flowing streams. <WH5104>
Thine is the day, <WH3117> Thine also <WH637> is the night; <WH3915> Thou hast prepared <WH3559> the light <WH3974> and the sun. <WH8121>
Thou hast established <WH5324> all <WH3605> the boundaries <WH1367> of the earth; <WH776> Thou hast made <WH3335> summer <WH7019> and winter. <WH2779>
Remember <WH2142> this, <WH384> O Lord, <WH3068> that the enemy <WH340> has reviled; <WH2778> And a foolish <WH5036> people <WH5971> has spurned <WH5006> Thy name. <WH8034>
Do not deliver <WH5414> the soul <WH5315> of Thy turtledove <WH8449> to the wild <WH9130> beast; <WH9130> Do not forget <WH7911> the life <WH9130> of Thine afflicted <WH6041> forever. <WH5331>
Consider <WH5027> the covenant; <WH1285> For the dark <WH4285> places <WH4285> of the land <WH776> are full <WH4390> of the habitations <WH4999> of violence. <WH2555>
Let not the oppressed <WH1790> return <WH7725> dishonored; <WH3637> Let the afflicted <WH6041> and needy <WH34> praise <WH1984> Thy name. <WH8034>
Do arise, <WH6965> O God, <WH430> [and] plead <WH7378> Thine own cause; <WH7379> Remember <WH2142> how the foolish <WH5036> man <WH5036> reproaches <WH2781> Thee all <WH3605> day <WH3117> long.
Do not forget <WH7911> the voice <WH6963> of Thine adversaries, <WH6887> The uproar <WH7588> of those who rise <WH6965> against Thee which ascends <WH5927> continually. <WH8548>
